official_title: A Randomized Phase 3 Interim Response Adapted Trial Comparing Standard Therapy With Immuno-oncology Therapy for Children and Adults With Newly Diagnosed Stage I and II Classic Hodgkin Lymphoma
brief_title: A Study to Compare Standard Therapy to Treat Hodgkin Lymphoma to the Use of Two Drugs, Brentuximab Vedotin and Nivolumab
cancer_type_display: A study comparing standard therapy to immunotherapy (brentuximab vedotin and nivolumab) for children and adults with newly diagnosed Stage I and II classic Hodgkin Lymphoma.
cancer_tags: Lugano Classification Limited Stage Hodgkin Lymphoma AJCC v8

key_inclusion_summary: Must be between 5 and 60 years of age.
Must have newly diagnosed, untreated, histologically confirmed classic Hodgkin lymphoma (cHL), Stage I or II.
Must have bidimensionally measurable disease (at least one lesion >= 1.5 cm).
Must have adequate performance status (Zubrod score 0-2 for adults; Lansky score >= 50 for pediatrics).
Must have adequate organ function (renal, hepatic, cardiac, and pulmonary).
key_exclusion_summary: Patients with nodular lymphocyte predominant Hodgkin lymphoma.
Prior chemotherapy, radiation, or antibody-based treatment for cHL.
Patients with a condition requiring systemic treatment with corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive medications.
Female patients who are pregnant or lactating.
